summary:
Skills, knowledge & interests:
— creative strategy, art direction, design, ux 
— visual communication & behavioural change
— campaigns, branding, editorial, web applications
— lecturer, workshops & projects on social design 
— design thinking, user-centered design research and design strategy
— catalyst for a positive social change 

Social Design Workshops
Teaching and lecturing design theory/thinking, design psychology and campaign development in the Netherlands. At the moment I am coaching and guiding students in their final projects and thesis development at the Faculty of digital media and creative industries (CMD, HVA Amsterdam). The last years I organised social design workshops 'A creative approach on...'​ at different art academies and design festivals in China, Mexico, Colombia, Finland, Turkey, Croatia, Senegal, Bulgaria, Polen, Romania, Skorpje and many more. Results can be seen on: www.mappingthecity.com

The book 'Hidden Persuasion'​
Author of the book 'Hidden Persuasion - 33 psychological influence techniques in advertising', 
co-authored by Dr. Matthijs van Leeuwen, Prof. Dr. Rick van Baaren, published by BIS Publishers, Amsterdam. For more information take a look at: 
www.hiddenpersuasion.net
www.wired.com/2014/06/5-hidden-visual-tricks-advertisers-use-to-sell-you/

More information about our knowledge and combination of psychology and design:
www.gedragendesign.nl

company.name: andrews:degen, studio for visual communication, design & society

profile_positions.description:
I hold a MA in editorial design & MA in behavioural science. 
In projects I like to combine these two fields of knowledge and skills.

visual communication, design & society
andrews:degen is a studio for visual communication. We develop strategies, concepts and identities and create authentic designs that clearly communicate. Attention to detail, love for typography and imagery, we strive for originality. We have a close working relationship with our clients. 
www.andrewsdegen.com

clients
andrews:degen works for national and international companies and institutions in the social, cultural and commercial sector. Clients include educational and governmental institutions, NGOs, consultancy and advertising agencies, galleries, festivals and start-ups. We dare to think beyond expectations and also across borders in a literal sense: A considerable number of our clients are based outside of the Netherlands. We work for institutions that provide bridges between the Netherlands and Germany: culturally, linguistically and economically. 

social design
andrews:degen is keen on sharing its thoughts on graphic design and social design with others. For our workshop series 'Mapping the City'​ we have visited so far cities in China, Mexico, Croatia, Moldova, Romania, Senegal, South Africa and Turkey. 
www.mappingthecity.com

behavioural change design
Together with D&B we are combining scientific knowledge about conscious and unconscious behaviour with design thinking and creativity to develop the appropriate message to communicate. Our aim is to work on projects fostering sustainable, healthy, preventative and prosocial behaviour, creating benefit for society.
www.gedragendesign.nl

A result from this collaboration is the book 'Hidden Persuasion', which shows the psychology behind advertising and how it influences consumer behaviour. The book has become part of the curriculum at several universities.
www.hiddenpersuasion.net
profile_positions.title: Creative partner, art direction & design

profile_positions.description:
In the last years I was teaching and organising workshops on different academies. The topics are relating to graphic design and visual communication, as e.g. design psychology, design theory, design thinking, social design, concept development and typography. Further I developed a workshop called 'Mapping the City - A creative approach on' which we organise on design events and academies around the world. Participants construct a social and cultural research in a visual form together with the students. At the moment I am coaching students in their final projects and thesis development at the Faculty of digital media and creative industries in Amsterdam.
